text:
Just sharing something I came across — no idea if this is significant news or not:
<https://deepmind.com/blog/open-sourcing-sonnet/>

attachments.title: Open sourcing Sonnet - a new library for constructing neural networks | DeepMind
attachments.text: We have found that the flexibility and adaptiveness of TensorFlow lends itself to building higher level frameworks for specific purposes, and we’ve written one for quickly building neural network modules with TF. We are actively developing this codebase, but what we have so far fits our research needs well, and we’re excited to announce that today we are open sourcing it. We call this framework Sonnet.
attachments.fallback: DeepMind: Open sourcing Sonnet - a new library for constructing neural networks | DeepMind

attachments.title: NSynth: Neural Audio Synthesis
attachments.text: One of the goals of Magenta is to use machine learning to develop new avenues of human expression. And so today we are proud to announce NSynth (Neural Synth...

text: the neural audio synthesis is a little weird to wrap my head around, but its learning how samples of instruments interact with one another, so you can synthesize actual instrument wave patterns that sound as if more than one instrument is playing for real near another one, not just a flat sample or flat wave generation
